programme.title: America's Greatest Prison Breaks
programme.desc: An account of the breakout of escaped killers Richard Matt and David Sweat from Clinton Correctional Prison in New York, as it was investigated by US Marshals and other officials.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: An insight into the secrets surrounding the 10 biggest and most mysterious conspiracies in history, including the goings-on at Area 51.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating the plans and goals of the world's most secretive organisations, considering whether elite groups of power players could be plotting the fate of the world.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The ten most life-threatening hunts undertaken by the Louisiana hunters.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Faced with storms, currents and deadly gators, the hunters risk life and limb to fill their tags. Revisit the scariest moments of the series in this special episode.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: John Thomson and Simon Day attend an auction of sheep carcasses, go on a snake hunt, and meet a man in the West Midlands with the world's largest collection of latex dolls.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: Simon Day and John Thomson explore Lancashire, where they eat the world's biggest breakfast, go clog dancing, and practise taxidermy using roadkill.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley compete to sell the most goods, with the loser having to pay a forfeit. A musician with limited funds seeks a new bass to replace the one he has broken.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les argue over an important decision, while a scientist turns up in the shop claiming his vintage device can cure diseases.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams go in search of cars to strip to a shell with a budget of Â£250 as they try to make the most money in the scrap metal market.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams cross the Channel to search for rusty Citroens in northern France which they can sell for profit at the scrap yard.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams go head-to-head breaking up typical boy racer cars to see whether a Citroen Saxo VTS or the Vauxhaull Corsa is worth more in scrap.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is delighted when a go-kart is brought in to be restored, while Tyler gets carried away in his eagerness to impress his father.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team tries to restore a 1960s motorbike ride and a damaged bumper car from the 1950s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team is presented with a rare 1950s British motorbike, before mending a 1940s penny scale.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron and Tyler make plans for Rick's stag night, and the team restores a three-wheeled all-terrain vehicle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team work on a tour car from the 1964 World's Fair and a vintage tool sharpener.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick cannot refuse when a stock car racer asks him to repair a 1970s motorcycle, but may have taken on more than he can handle.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The Count's Kustoms crew revisit some of their most unique projects, including a commemorative go-kart fire truck and a one of a kind Can-Am Spider.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Revisit some of the craziest rides ever featured on the series, including a bus transformed into a giant green monster.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Reliving some of the crazy rides featured on the series, including a '74 Ford F100 that Danny Koker could not bear to part with.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny Koker and his team of car experts revisit some of the most eccentric and famous clients to walk through the doors at Count's Kustoms.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.sub-title: Best Of: One Of A Kind Commissions
programme.desc: Series following Danny Koker and his team of car experts as they remodel unusual vehicles.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny Koker and the Count's Kustoms crew revisit some of the most outrageous rides ever featured on the show.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The crew rediscover some of their favourite paint jobs in Counting Cars history, including a 92 Ford ambulance they converted into a spooky ghost-hunting machine.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Take a look back at some of the finest classic cars to grace the Counting Cars garage, like a museum-worthy 1914 Model T pie wagon.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: The guys find an orange Reliant Kitten that an engineer has given up on - the body is detached from the chassis, it doesn't run and most of the bits it needs are in boxes in the boot. But Will and Gus are sure there's money to be made from it. Series 2, Episode 9.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: The guys want to buy a BMW, and Will says he likes the âfeminine' Z3. There's a trade-in up the road which might fit the bill but it's a high price. Can they get the deal they want?.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus has his eye on a classic Renault 5 that's cheap and clean. Will isn't sure but Gus twists his arm. It's super-rare, and has little wrong with it - apart from a cooling issue that they can't see, let alone fix. Series 2, Episode 7.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: The guys wants to do a 4x4, but their dream list of cars is short as they can't afford much on their budget. However, Will has a cunning plan, and steers them towards a friend's Suzuki.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will want a classic Morris Minor, and they find an ex-police car in a lovely shade of blue. But the seller wants them to bid online - they can't pay and take it away..

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will go for the once-maligned Austin Maestro. The car they want to buy has already been sold but the seller has another - his own - on the driveway. Can they do a deal?.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will want to buy an MGB roadster but the cheaper GT version is the one they find. It's got a few rust patches, and back in the workshop they realise beauty really is skin deep....

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod reveals to Brandi that he has an alter ego, while Ivy attends auctions in Moreno Valley.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Casey tries to restrain Rene's spending habits, while Darrell and Brandon rely on their intuition to beat the competition. Elsewhere, Ivy plans to spy on Jarrod and Brandi's buying strategy.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry discover which of them is this series' winner.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Matt Lucas, Holly Walsh and Susan Calman join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig opens her post in a post-themed edition. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actress and comedy writer Jennifer Saunders takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with artist Grayson Perry and stand-up Matt Forde joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Sliced
programme.desc: Joshua plucks up the courage to ask Naomi out, only to find she's already lined up another date. Ricky's plan to save the day backfires and Mario has a big date of his own to go on.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by presenter Richard Madeley and actor Sanjeev Bhaskar, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes naturalist Kate Humble and comedian Miles Jupp. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Ed Byrne, Gary Delaney, Ivo Graham and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Rob loves the great outdoors and is after the perfect lifestyle vehicle. Rebecca thinks Jaguar and Jeep but Elo asks Rob a different question.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Elo and Rebecca search for a vehicle for an 18-year-old DJ who likes mod-cons and fast cars.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The crowds gather in Switzerland for more downhill drama, applauding the ingenuity of these amateur teams as the racers crash into hay bales.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Austin, Eddie Hall takes on Superbike legend Colin 'Texas Tornado' Edwards in a strength vs speed race - and sets his own eating challenge from eight of the city's food trucks.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Manhattan, Eddie Hall goes head to head with long-time rival Brian Shaw, pulling a 23-tonne truck - and attempting the notorious skyscraper 'Monster' sandwich from Sarge's Deli.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank learn it is not always easy getting what they want when they face down some of the toughest negotiators on the road.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank face their fears in this series showcasing the most memorable finds by the duo.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Featuring all the thrills and spills from the 2013 Red Bull Soapbox Race in London, as the crews unleash their four-wheeled, motorless creations on a challenging downhill course littered with obstacles.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy about the romance between a couple with differing cultures and backgrounds. Gavin and Stacey have flirted for months on the phone at work but have never met up - until she travels from Wales to London to see him. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star alongside Rob Brydon, Alison Steadman, Ruth Jones and James Corden.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple have their first lovers' tiff and Gavin is so beside himself with worry he drives all the way to Barry Island to resolve things. Stacey finally agrees to return to Billericay with her beau, prompting his proud mum Pamela to set about cleaning the house from top to bottom. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans drive to Wales for the wedding fayre, and after a momentous trip to the church for the reading of the banns, Nessa tells Stacey her big secret. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The bride-to-be goes on a hen party, while Gavin embarks on two stag nights, the second of which reveals shocking secrets about his fiancee that could jeopardise the wedding. Elsewhere, the early return of Stacey's brother Jason horrifies Uncle Bryn. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Stacey's brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best man's speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the international event from London's Alexandra Palace in which amateur drivers race home-made, engineers vehicles. Over the years, vehicles have ranged from a piano to a giant baby carriage, and the latest contenders include C-17 Roadmaster, Braking Badly, Poldark Express and Turbo Tugboat.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton return for the domestic comedy, which sees the couple continuing to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In the first episode, Geoffrey reluctantly allows Lee to help Lucy clear up the builder's mess in their new kitchen extension. With Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy arranges a special surprise for Lee's birthday, which sees their family and friends joining them in a Crystal Maze-style physical adventure game where the objective is to escape from a series of rooms. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A missing toy keyring leads to a rift between Lee and Lucy and their best friends and former neighbours Toby and Anna. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy get a family pet in an attempt to teach the children to be more responsible. But as ever, things do not quite work out as planned. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with a guest appearance from former EastEnders actress Annette Badland (Aunt Babe).

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Ed Byrne, Gary Delaney, Ivo Graham and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by presenter Richard Madeley and actor Sanjeev Bhaskar, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes naturalist Kate Humble and comedian Miles Jupp. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: How the Allies came closer to victory in 1944, as Russian forces made advances on the Eastern Front and the US recaptured the Philippines.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Archive pictures and eyewitness testimony reveal how the Allies finally achieved victory, following a series of successes in Europe and the Far East.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: Examining the complex system the Nazis set up to implement the extermination of the Jewish race throughout Europe from 1942, with Auschwitz as the hub. The programme reveals that at other camps, including Treblinka, Belzec and Sobibor, rival commanders participated in the genocide with enthusiasm and shared ideas for the best method of mass murder.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: An underground city beneath a forest in Northern France built to house 3,000 people, an ice cave under Iceland's biggest glacier, and a subterranean power station in London.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Meeting the Welsh Highland Railway's oldest volunteer fireman, 80-year-old Cedric Lodge, who has worked on the railways for 60 years. In Devon, there is a look at the Autotrain.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Father and son Bill and Frankie McAteer are killed in an apparent car accident on their way home from work at Billingsgate Market, but Nikki and Jack arrive to discover the younger man's body is riddled with bullets. Back at the Lyell centre, Clarissa summons her husband Max, a digital forensics expert, to help crack the case - and he uncovers disturbing video evidence showing a sexual encounter between Frankie, his girlfriend Becky and best friend Liam. Crime drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice receives a surprise visit from her father's mistress and is shocked to learn the truth about her financial difficulties, while Evie begins her first day as an apprentice dressmaker. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Boon
programme.desc: Harry falls for jazz club owner Jo Beckett and plans to marry her and invest in the club. He even makes preparations to sell his share of CBS to a rival security firm. Michael Elphick stars in this seasonal episode.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The birth of Tilly's baby brings excitement to the workshop, but Beatrice is still concerned about her own future. Evie accuses Daniel of betraying her trust.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Joe competes in a boxing match, with the odds favouring him to win. Meanwhile, Collette sets her heart on a wedding Jo cannot afford.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New CID recruit DC Suzie Sim makes an impressive debut at Sun Hill by speedily solving a hate crime, but also uncovers alarming evidence that Terry's nephew Bradley could be a victim of abuse. Samantha faces an uphill task convincing her colleagues that Abi has been abducted, while Kerry's uncharacteristic waspishness causes concern and Honey's gossiping about her date with Steve backfires.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ric turns 50 so the staff throw a surprise party for him - but tensions end up running high and many relationships are put to the test as Jess tries to make Zubin jealous, Tricia attempts to seduce Carlos, and Connie enjoys playing mind games with Will. Meanwhile, Diane can't decide whether to accept Owen's offer, and Chrissie reminds her how unreliable he can be.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mike and Charlie fly by helicopter to assist the recovery of a youth who has falled from a tree onto a rock face while stealing bird eggs, and apart from his immediate injuries it transpires he has a chronic condition that also requires treatment. Jude's ex-boyfriend is brought in with a serious head injury.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim's gambling habit looks like it's about to be exposed when he's spotted at a dog track by Steve and Honey, while Terry arrests his own brother on a trumped-up charge, determined to discover whether he's really abusing his sons. Elsewhere, an act of vandalism at a church leads Tony to a wholly unexpected encounter with another of the Radford boys - has this scion of the notorious crime family really become a man of the cloth?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kathy and Rachel set off to meet Wilmott-Brown, the man who raped Kathy.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pete is determined to deal out a bit of old fashioned justice to Wilmott-Brown.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne oversees the opening of a family planning clinic at the local community centre, leading mother-of-three Wilma Goddens to start taking the contraceptive pill behind her husband's back. Barbara is distraught when she discovers that her father has accepted a missionary posting in New Guinea for the next three years so will not be able to officiate at her wedding, while Violet suffers terribly with hot flushes, Christopher asks Trixie to meet his daughter, and Delia's heartache may finally be over.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Boxing Day sees heavy snowfall covering the country and the adverse weather causes major disruption across Poplar as roads become blocked and pipes freeze meaning families have to queue outside for water from standpipes. Sister Julienne must inform a family about the death of their loved one and uncovers an uncomfortable truth, while Valerie helps an unmarried couple living in a caravan prepare for their baby, but unforeseen complications knock her confidence in her ability as a midwife. Guest starring Anita Dobson.

programme.title: The 39 Steps
programme.desc: Rupert Penry-Jones stars in this adaptation of John Buchan's classic novel, set in 1914. Engineer Richard Hannay is bored and restless in London - until he meets Scudder, who claims to be a British spy. When the agent is killed in his flat, Hannay is thrown headlong into adventure, forced to go on the run under suspicion of murder. Fleeing to Scotland, with police and spies on his tail, he teams up with feisty suffragette Victoria Sinclair, and although they fail to hit it off, the couple become increasingly reliant on each other as they race to unmask a traitor and save Great Britain from German invasion. Action thriller, co-starring Eddie Marsan and Lydia Leonard.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Compo and Clegg are put in charge of the annual gala parade, so they visit Auntie Wainwright in the hope of renting a bouncy castle. Festive edition of the rural comedy from 1992, starring Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest becomes embroiled in an audacious art heist masterminded by his adversary Flambeau, who intends to use Father Brown and his friends to help him settle an old score. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.sub-title: The Secret of the Flame Tree
programme.desc: The Saint Marie Literary Festival is rocked by the death of a young literature student - and Florence's childhood friend - whose body is discovered at the bottom of a cliff. Suicide seems the likely cause, but as ever Humphrey isn't so keen to jump to conclusions - even with the presence of a note in the victim's bag. But with everyone the dead girl knew at the festival, who could have pushed her over the edge? Away from the investigation, the inspector is busy preparing the shack for Martha's stay. Sun-soaked whodunit, guest starring Fiona Allen, Ramon Tikaram and Monica Dolan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Back home in Bermondsey for his youngest daughter's wedding, Gerry is visited by Ralph Paxton, an old friend recently released from prison who wants him investigate the murder of his grandson. Meanwhile, a newly divorced Sasha is forced to work with ex-husband Ned Hancock, Danny puts the body language skills he has acquired on an FBI course to the test, and Gerry's daughter Caitlin gets upset when her father interrogates her fiance about his credentials. Cold case drama, starring Dennis Waterman, Tamzin Outhwaite and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by David Hayman (Trial & Retribution).

credits.actor: a guest appearance by David Hayman (Trial & Retribution)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki travels to Mexico to attend the funeral of Luisa, a former intern at the Lyell Centre who was murdered in a carjacking in her native country. She soon stumbles across the post-mortem report and realises that the body is not that of her ex-colleague. Assisted by Dr Eva Vasquez and fired up with the idea that Luisa might still be alive, Nikki and Jack trace her last-known movements and are led to a farm where a cartel massacre was carried out. Crime drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky Midnight News
programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Real Chernobyl
programme.desc: Sky News documentary special meeting people in Ukraine who were involved in the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in 1986.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Hotspots: On the Frontline
programme.desc: Alex Crawford meets former child soldiers in war torn South Sudan, while Stuart Ramsay examines the devastating aftermath of the 2018 California wildfires.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Knocked Up (2007)
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents-to-be decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Manchester's Olivia Davidson-Slack, and Will Oakley from Southampton take part in the dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby. Both Olivia and Will must decide which of three potential suitors they would like to accompany on a date, but must make their choice by interviewing their would-be sweetheart's families.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott explores Trinidad, where he visits a Hindu temple built on land reclaimed from the sea, prepares grilled tamarind tofu with callaloo pesto, and samples a local speciality - curried chickpeas in a fried bread roll. On a visit to Maracas Bay, he makes a coconut Caribbean chai.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A mischievous trickster finally gets his comeuppance when his body is found floating below the weir in Midsomer Deverell. The extent of his double life starts to emerge when three family friends and a long-lost niece produce wills claiming his fortune, and his collection of erotic photographs from the 1960s gives Barnaby and Jones the key to the tangled relationships and feuds blighting the family.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Twister (1996)
programme.desc: A storm-chaser and her estranged husband are brought together in a joint project to monitor the path of an oncoming tornado - but the pair face a race against the clock as a rival government-backed group with hi-tech resources tries to beat them to it. Action thriller, starring Helen Hunt, Bill Paxton, Cary Elwes, Jami Gertz and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.sub-title: Quiz Beasts from the South East
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, with five pub quizzers from south-east London answering questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Strictly Come Dancing head judge Shirley Ballas, Mrs Brown's Boys star Danny O'Carroll and Corrie's Andy Whyment to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the Â£20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Dani Harmer, Eddie Hall, Chemmy Alcott and Alex Horne pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show which takes place in public locations around the UK. He invites passers-by in Bournemouth to take part in a series of unusual challenges, ending with a game of In for a Penny, in which the contestants could pocket Â£1,000

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: David anxiously awaits some results, Marlon is worried by some news, and Charity makes a plan.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: As the police investigate Gary's dealings, they believe he's been operating as a loan shark. Ryan tells Ray that he can stick his job, Tyrone suspects that Kevin fancies Abi, and when Tracy reveals that Amy is looking for work experience in the solicitors' office, Paula offers a placement with her.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle gets very close to nature as he takes a chilly naked dip in one of Snowdonia's hidden lakes. Liz Bonnin heads to the Dark Skies Park in Galloway, where she hopes to inspire a group of inner-city youngsters with a nocturnal safari. Yorkshire Dales shepherdess Amanda Owen and her family welcome baby number nine into the flock.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: The residents reel as the true nature of Gary's work is revealed following the Christmas Day shooting. Johnny and Jenny confront Ray in the bistro, outraged that he's trying to scupper their New Year's Eve party. When Abi reveals she's meeting Kevin for a drink, Sally realises her ex still fancies the mechanic.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Celebrity Re-Play 2019
programme.desc: The comedian and chat show host is joined by six celebrity guests for a special games night as they look back at some of the most memorable moments of the past 12 months, from Stormzy's spectacular Glastonbury set to England almost winning the Rugby World Cup and Boris Johnson's failed attempt to shut down Parliament. Angellica Bell joins Alan in overseeing proceedings, which features a mixture of comedy moments, surprise guests, and one famous couple having the chance to win Â£25,000 for charity.

programme.title: The Holiday (2006)
programme.desc: Two single women living on opposite sides of the Atlantic agree to exchange houses over the Christmas holidays. In their new surroundings, both women unexpectedly encounter prospective partners, but as the house swap draws to a close, difficult decisions have to be made about their blossoming relationships. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jack Black, Jude Law and Eli Wallach.

programme.title: Are We Alone?
programme.desc: Scientists compare the extreme environments of distant worlds with those found in remote areas of Earth, in the hope of gaining new insights in the search for extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons, oversees the clash between Lancashire's The Water's Edge and The Hand and Heart from Peterborough.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Peculiar pedestrians take to the road, and reckless drivers throw caution in the wind. Plus, dash-cams continue to capture people behaving in inexplicable ways.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic compilation of some of the most daring drivers who take speed to the next levels. Featuring unusual pedestrians and a party on wheels like no other.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A collision on a racetrack results in a multi-car pile-up, houses are swept away by floodwaters, a man is sucked into a jet engine, and an F1 powerboat takes off.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A massive explosion occurs at a propane plant, a boat and its passengers are sucked under a ferry, a dragster disintegrates at 130mph, and a racing boat crashes.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revive a rare and valuable fairground ride, then resuscitate a Victorian park bench and a century-old gentleman's suitcase.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: A woman calls in the team to help restore her husband's Nova.

programme.title: Big, Big Bikes
programme.desc: Part one of two. A celebration of the excesses of the vehicle, including its most outrageous machines and riders.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: Luxury ship the Europa 2 sets sail on its first-ever surprise cruise - where guests vote on which ports to visit.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: Just a couple of months after entering service, Viking Sea sets sail from London to Scotland and then Norway. However to get there, the crew faces numerous challenges.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: Just seven weeks after launching, the Carnival Vista, with its 1,400 crew, go to the Old World. Each day sees new challenges, including an at-sea medical evacuation.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: The largest sailing cruise ship on Earth, the Royal Clipper is a pleasurable voyage for guests. However, its crew faces challenges, including torn sails and traffic off Sicily.

programme.title: Mighty Cruise Ships
programme.desc: With an strengthened hull for ice, Ocean Endeavour is made for adventure. As it traverses fog and icebergs in Arctic waters, there are reports of a polar bear sighting.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Exploring the construction and inner workings of the Robert E Peary, an American military supply ship.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Exploring the inner workings of the Skandi Arctic, the world's largest and most technologically advanced dive support ship.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: The engineering innovations that enable passenger ferry Stena Britannica to simultaneously function as a car carrier, cargo transporter and cruise ship.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Inside the USCGC Bertholf, a ship designed to enable US Homeland Security officers to patrol the seas.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Inside the CCGS Amundsen, an icebreaker equipped with advanced technologies to enable scientists in the Arctic to carry out research on the impact of global warming.

programme.title: Bermuda Triangle Exposed
programme.desc: The mysterious region of the Atlantic Ocean, where freak waves and giant whirlpools have been blamed for plane and boat disappearances.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Devon, Drew Pritchard rummages through a heap railway items collected over 30 years by a local enthusiast. He then digs out treasure at a recently closed glove factory in Yeovil.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve battles flooded highways when his truck breaks down, leaving him stranded. Later, tensions flare when trainee trucker Danyelle gets a driving lesson from her husband.

programme.title: Shark Rampage 1916
programme.desc: Recounting the true story of the 1916 shark attack that inspired Oscar-winning blockbuster film Jaws.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A teacher who cries crystals, a woman with brittle bones, a prematurely aged teenager and a boy with butterfly skin.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Andrew Nesbitt, found dead on his 46th birthday in his Wisconsin apartment after a night out. Officers sought clues from CCTV in local bars, cabs and street corners.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When 12-year-old Alajawan Brown is shot dead outside a shop in Washington, near to an earlier shooting, police refer to CCTV to see if the two are connected. S5/14/16.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Forensic Detectives investigates the thin line between love and hate, while tracking the vicious histories of deadly lovers and their evil spouses.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Report on the trial and conviction of New York Mafia boss Vincent Gigante, nicknamed the Oddfather, who was accused of ordering the deaths of seven gangsters and plotting to kill others as revenge for unsanctioned Mob murders.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The work of the Michigan Humane Society, a four-strong team of animal welfare officers that deals with more than 4,000 cases of cruelty and neglect every year.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown has an all-night marathon in a canine maternity ward, and a rabbit is hit with a bad case of heatstroke.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: HuffPost Live correspondent Caitlyn Becker visits the shop, but cannot decide between two dresses, while another customer wants the first gown she sees.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Following the work of Dr Sandra Lee, a dermatologist who known for her YouTube channel where she streams videos of procedures.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: The story of Melissa, who covered her huge lipoma with a sweatshirt for years. Tyler's fear of cancer stopped his head lumps being diagnosed, and Tahj is covered in painful boils.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Ronen has a huge but mysterious lump above his knee. Meanwhile, Amber is suffering from a debilitating skin disease that no one understands.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Anthony's cyst is treated in the area called the Triangle of Death, and Shane wants to get a lump removed off his back.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Belinda's lump on her neck causes her to be immobile, and Nicole will not get married until she gets her arm pit lump removed. Meanwhile, Nick unwisely removed a lipoma at home.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.sub-title: The Curious Case of the Pooting Cyst
programme.desc: Diane has thousands of tumours all over her body that have ruined her life. Plus, Will is worried his shoulder lump will be ripped open at work.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: It is a busy time for dermatologist Dr Sandra Lee as she treats patients looking to fix their skin issues ahead of the festive season.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Dr Emma Craythorne and her team of experts are on a mission to solve complex skin conditions. Louise's skin problem has taken over her life and now she desperately needs help. Plus, the cysts, blackheads and acne on 43-year-old Scott's back is ruining his life.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Twenty four-year-old Elise visits Dr Emma Craythorne in a last-ditch attempt to fix her excruciatingly painful skin condition, while Gary wants a lump on the back of his head removed.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Gavin consults Dr Emma Craythorne about the smelly blisters in his armpits and groin. Abi suffers from severe acne but has a fear of needles and swallowing tablets.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Rachael's body is covered in hundreds of lumps and bumps, so Emma tries to help her live a more normal life. John seeks surgery for his nose, which has become big and bulbous.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Twenty-year-old Mariah visits Dr Emma about her severe acne. Jonathan has around 40 fatty lumps under his skin, and young mum Holly worries she has two extra nipples.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: A man who always longed for siblings stumbles upon a shocking family murder. Plus, host Lisa Joyner meets a woman who is eager to find her biological mother.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: If I'd Only Known About Her
programme.desc: A desperate man hopes co-host Lisa Joyner can help end a 57-year search for his infant sister, who he has never stopped loving. Co-presented by Chris Jacobs.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A tumultuous relationship with her husband caused Tamy Lyn's weight to reach more than 500lbs. Isolated from the outside world, she needs help to restart her life.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Following a woman and two of her children who were all born with Crouzon syndrome, a genetic disorder that affects skull growth, and how they cope with the condition.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: An American woman searches for treatment to deal with a rare medical condition that leaves her constantly aroused.
